org.skife.jdbi.v2

Interface IDBI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBI

    public interface IDBI
    An interface for DBI instances for systems which like to work with interfaces.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close(Object sqlObject)
      Used to close a sql object which lacks a close() method.
      void define(String key, Object value)
      Define an attribute on every StatementContext for every statement created from a handle obtained from this DBI instance.

      A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients.

      A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients.

      Create a new sql object which will obtain and release connections from this dbi instance, as it needs to, and can, respectively.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close(Object sqlObject)
        Used to close a sql object which lacks a close() method.
        Parameters:
        sqlObject - the sql object to close

      • define

        void define(String key,
            Object value)
        Define an attribute on every StatementContext for every statement created from a handle obtained from this DBI instance.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the attribute
        value - the value for the attribute

      • inTransaction

        <ReturnType> ReturnType inTransaction(TransactionCallback<ReturnType> callback)
                               throws CallbackFailedException
        A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients. The handle will be in a transaction when the callback is invoked, and that transaction will be committed if the callback finishes normally, or rolled back if the callback raises an exception.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback which will receive an open Handle, in a transaction
        Returns:
        the value returned by callback
        Throws:
        CallbackFailedException - Will be thrown if callback raises an exception. This exception will wrap the exception thrown by the callback.

      • inTransaction

        <ReturnType> ReturnType inTransaction(TransactionIsolationLevel isolation,
                                      TransactionCallback<ReturnType> callback)
                               throws CallbackFailedException
        A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients. The handle will be in a transaction when the callback is invoked, and that transaction will be committed if the callback finishes normally, or rolled back if the callback raises an exception.
        Parameters:
        isolation - The transaction isolation level to set
        callback - A callback which will receive an open Handle, in a transaction
        Returns:
        the value returned by callback
        Throws:
        CallbackFailedException - Will be thrown if callback raises an exception. This exception will wrap the exception thrown by the callback.

      • onDemand

        <SqlObjectType> SqlObjectType onDemand(Class<SqlObjectType> sqlObjectType)
        Create a new sql object which will obtain and release connections from this dbi instance, as it needs to, and can, respectively. You should not explicitely close this sql object
        Type Parameters:
        SqlObjectType -
        Parameters:
        sqlObjectType - an interface with annotations declaring desired behavior
        Returns:
        a new sql object of the specified type, with a dedicated handle

      • open

        Handle open()
        Obtain a Handle to the data source wrapped by this DBI instance
        Returns:
        an open Handle instance
        See Also:
        DBI.open()

      • open

        <SqlObjectType> SqlObjectType open(Class<SqlObjectType> sqlObjectType)
        Open a handle and attach a new sql object of the specified type to that handle. Be sure to close the sql object (via a close() method, or calling close(Object)
        Type Parameters:
        SqlObjectType -
        Parameters:
        sqlObjectType - an interface with annotations declaring desired behavior
        Returns:
        a new sql object of the specified type, with a dedicated handle

      • useHandle

        void useHandle(HandleConsumer callback)
        throws CallbackFailedException
        A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback which will receive an open Handle
        Throws:
        CallbackFailedException - Will be thrown if callback raises an exception. This exception will wrap the exception thrown by the callback.

      • useTransaction

        void useTransaction(TransactionConsumer callback)
             throws CallbackFailedException
        A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients. The handle will be in a transaction when the callback is invoked, and that transaction will be committed if the callback finishes normally, or rolled back if the callback raises an exception.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback which will receive an open Handle, in a transaction
        Throws:
        CallbackFailedException - Will be thrown if callback raises an exception. This exception will wrap the exception thrown by the callback.

      • useTransaction

        void useTransaction(TransactionIsolationLevel isolation,
                    TransactionConsumer callback)
             throws CallbackFailedException
        A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients. The handle will be in a transaction when the callback is invoked, and that transaction will be committed if the callback finishes normally, or rolled back if the callback raises an exception.
        Parameters:
        isolation - The transaction isolation level to set
        callback - A callback which will receive an open Handle, in a transaction
        Throws:
        CallbackFailedException - Will be thrown if callback raises an exception. This exception will wrap the exception thrown by the callback.

      • withHandle

        Parameters:
        callback - A callback which will receive an open Handle
        Returns:
